alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 25 at 2:01AM CDT until March 25 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL DEKALB COUNTY... At 201 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles southeast of Ider, or 13 miles northeast of Fort Payne, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Valley Head, Hammondville and Mentone. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for northeastern Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
